short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Remove immovable position: fixed objects from the page

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Removes certain elements from the page, increasing readability without a huge, invasive extension.

Nothing is done automatically, simply click the button to clean-up the page.

The screenshot shows the effect on the Washington Post website, which is (at the time of writing) a particularly bad offender:
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2015/10/27/a-dog-shoots-a-person-almost-every-year-in-america/

Changelog:

2.0: additionally find :before and :after elements, e.g. the Wordpress Twenty Sixteen theme.
1.0: initial release

https://github.com/FauxFaux/fix-fixed
